exclusion:
1. Setup the controller you are using to exclude a device from the network.
2. Tap either the top or the bottom of the left switch once.
inclusion:
Including to the Network (Must be installed in permanent location, not on test bench).
1. Setup the controller you are using to include a device into network.
2. Tap either the top or bottom of the left switch once
label: ZRM230
overview:
Radio Frequency Controlled, 6A, 230 VAC, European Wall Mounted 3-Way Switch, Dual Switch, Release 1.1  

The ZRM230 Wall Mounted 3-Way Switch is a component of the HomePro lighting control system. This Wall Mounted Switch is designed to work with other Z-Wave enabled devices. Z-Wave nodes of other types can be added to the system and will also act as repeaters if they support this function of repeating the signal received to other modules in the system.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Ignore start level
parameters.description: Set ignore start level bit when transmitting dim commands.
parameters.overview: The ZRM230 can send Dim commands to Z-Wave enabled dimmers. The Dim command has a start level embedded in it. A dimmer receiving this command will start dimming from that start level. However, the command also has a bit that indicates whether the dimmer should ignore the start level. If the bit is set to 1, the dimmer will ignore the start level and instead start dimming from its current level. If this bit is set to 0, the dimmer will ignore the start level.

parameters.label: Suspend Group 4
parameters.description: Disable transmitting commands to group 4 devices.
parameters.overview: You may wish to disable transmitting commands to Z-Wave devices that are in Group 4 without “disassociating” those devices from the group. Setting parameter 2 to the value of 1 will stop the ZRM230 from transmitting todevices that are “associated” into Group 4.

parameters.label: Night Light
parameters.overview: The LED on the ZRM230 will by default, turn ON when the load attached is turned ON. To make the LED turn ON when the load attached is turned OFF instead, set parameter 3 to a value of 1.

parameters.label: Invert Switch
parameters.overview: To change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch ON , set parameter 4 to 1. Note: If you invert the switches and also install the product upside down, remember the load will now be controlled by the right, not the left switch.

parameters.label: Enable Shade Control Group 2
parameters.description: Operate shade control devices on group 2.
parameters.overview: The ZRM230 can operate shade control devices via its group 2 if this configuration parameter is set to 1.

parameters.label: Enable Shade Control Group 3
parameters.description: Operate shade control devices on group 3.
parameters.overview: The ZRM230 can operate shade control devices via its group 3 if this configuration parameter is set to 1.

parameters.label: LED Transmission Indication
parameters.overview: The ZRM230 will flicker its LED when it is transmitting to any of its 4 groups. This flickering can be set to notflicker at all (set to 0), to flicker the entire time it is transmitting (set to 1), or to flicker for only 1 second when it begins transmitting (set to 2). By default, the ZRM230 is set to flicker for only 1 second.

parameters.label: Poll Group 2 Interval
parameters.overview: Poll Group 2 Interval (minutes), valid values = 1 through 255 (Default value is 2).

parameters.label: Poll Group 2
parameters.overview: Poll Group 2, if value is 1, the ZRM230 will poll group 2 at the interval set in configuration Parameter 20.

associations.label: Controller updates
associations.description: Group used to inform devices about the updates of the status of the device.
